text:
Multivariable Calculus | Differentiable implies continuous.

if [imath] f(\vec{x}) [/imath] is clifferenticible ot [imath] \vec{a} [/imath] then it is continuous at [imath] \vec{a} [/imath]\n[imath]\begin{array}{l}\n\lim _{\vec{x} \rightarrow \vec{\alpha}} f(\vec{x})-f(\vec{a})= \\\n\quad \lim _{\vec{x} \rightarrow \vec{\alpha}}\left(\frac{R(\vec{x})}{\|\vec{x}-\vec{a}\|}\|\vec{x}-\vec{a}\|+\nabla f \cdot(\vec{x}-\vec{a})\right)=0\n\end{array}[/imath][imath]\lim _{\vec{x} \rightarrow \vec{\alpha}} f(\vec{x})-f(\vec{a})= [/imath] [imath]\quad \lim _{\vec{x} \rightarrow \vec{\alpha}}\left(\frac{R(\vec{x})}{\|\vec{x}-\vec{a}\|}\|\vec{x}-\vec{a}\|+abla f \cdot(\vec{x}-\vec{a})\right)=0[/imath]
